snippet: Spills in Arkansas and Utah have raised more questions about whether the Keystone XL project and the nation’s labyrinth of pipelines are being adequately monitored.
abstract: Pipeline spills in Arkansas and Utah prompt new criticism from opponents of proposed Keystone XL project, and raise questions about whether federal government is adequately monitoring nation's vast labyrinth of pipelines.
lead_paragraph: Spills in Arkansas and Utah have raised more questions about whether the Keystone XL project and the nation’s labyrinth of pipelines are being adequately monitored.

headline.seo: Pipeline Spills Stir New Criticism of Keystone Proposal
